introMarkdown:
"Progress is not just about the destination; it's about the journey we take to get there." 

During the period of November 10 to November 17, 2025, HoverKraft Tech successfully shipped three releases across three repositories. The busiest project was ci-github-common, which contributed significantly to our progress with one release. The most recent release during this timeframe was ci-github-nodejs version 0.18.0, launched on November 13, 2025.

- Total repositories covered: 3
- Total releases shipped: 3
- Busiest project: ci-github-common (1 release, 3 stars)
closingMarkdown:
During the period from November 10, 2025, to November 17, 2025, a total of three repositories were covered, with three releases shipped. The busiest project was ci-github-common, which had one release and received three stars. The most recent release was ci-github-nodejs version 0.18.0. 

Here are the repositories to note:

- ci-github-common (1 release, 3⭐)
- ci-github-publish (1 release, 2⭐)
- ci-github-nodejs (1 release, 1⭐)

In summary, the week was productive with multiple releases across several repositories, highlighting the ongoing development efforts.

- Review the release notes for ci-github-nodejs 0.18.0.
- Gather feedback on the ci-github-common project to improve its features.
- Plan the next set of enhancements for ci-github-publish based on user input.

repositories.name: ci-github-common
repositories.description: Opinionated GitHub actions and workflows for common continuous integration needs

highlights: Public: documentation for actions and workflows has been refreshed and clarified.
Internal: CI checks were re-enabled and permissions tightened, GitHub Actions dependencies were updated.

repositories.name: ci-github-nodejs
repositories.description: Opinionated Github actions and workflows for continuous integration in NodeJs context

highlights: In **continuous-integration**, artifacts are now addressed by id instead of name and reporting for lint and tests has been upgraded with PR annotations, covera…
Internal changes: documentation for actions/workflows was updated and dependency groups for GitHub Actions and npm were bumped across multiple directories.

repositories.name: ci-github-publish
repositories.description: Opinionated GitHub actions and workflows for streamlined release, deployment, and publishing.

highlights: Release actions now include the full documentation set in the published artifact to ensure complete distributions.
Internal: refreshed GitHub Actions dependencies and updated workflow documentation.
